issue.title: [CF 883] Elvui conflict
issue.body:
IMPORTANT: If your issue is only occurring with a specific icon, include an export string of the icon in this ticket. Subsequently, if the issue involves an entire group or an entire profile, include the entire export string of the group or profile.

To get an export string, open the icon editor, and click button labeled "Import/Export/Backup". Select the "To string" option for the appropriate export type (icon, group, or profile), and then press CTRL+C to copy it to your clipboard.

FAILURE TO COMPLY WITH THE ABOVE INSTRUCTIONS WILL RESULT IN YOUR TICKET BEING INVALIDATED.

What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. Enable Tellmewhen
2. Enable ElvUI
3. Open Elvui config by typing /ec

What do you expect to happen? What happens instead?
The buttons of the config frame are red instead of the usual black. This only happens when TellmeWhen is loaded too.

EDIT: apparently every template (tabs, + and - buttons etc...) are the usual Blizzard ones instead of the Elvui default ones.

What version of TellMeWhen are you using? ("The latest" is not a version)
v.7.0.0.r189 (g8faf75a)

Do you have an error log of what happened?
Nope

Please provide any additional information below (including any export strings if applicable; see above.)
ElvUI version 6.72


> Posted by CurseForge user Jeremybell | Imported from CurseForge issue #883 | Raw

comments.body:
Unable to reproduce.

Regardless, this is an issue with ElvUI, not an issue with TellMeWhen. I can promise you that TMW doesn't have a section of code that attempts to recolor ElvUI's configuration.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

It only happens when I load Tellmewhen, no matter if it is a fresh reinstall without any options. It not only affects my ElvUI buttons, but also my Recount buttons in the interface options. Is it maybe a bug with AceGUI 3.0? Since Recount and ElvUI and TellmeWhen use this library.


> Posted by CurseForge user Jeremybell

Are you using ElvUI AddOnSkins? If, so, I would suspect that it is the culprit.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Hi.

I did some research (after testing elvuiaddonskins, which wasn't the problem) and it appears that version 6.2.6-179-gab25780 correctly works, but 6.2.6-182-g5d92d3d and later versions are breaking the buttons. I cloned your git and looked into the git diff, but couldn't find the 179 and the 182 version.

I hope this gives a bit more information and maybe could you give me some hints which files I need to test to find the problem?


> Posted by CurseForge user Jeremybell

OK, I will take a look it when I get a chance.

For some reason, CurseForge likes to prefix the SHA1 hashes of each git commit with a 'g'. The 179 and 182 are just put there to establish some meaningful sense of order in the files.

The versions you are looking for are ab25780 and 5d92d3d.

Edited Nov 4, 2013

> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Here are the changes between those revisions:

CHANGELOG.txt  .txt    Modified    2    1
** Self explanatory - changelog changes. Can't break anything.

Components/Core/Conditions/Categories/Misc.lua  .lua    Modified    6    2
** Changed the way that the Lua condition works. Couldn't break anything.

Components/IconModules/IconModule_IconContainer_Masque/IconContainer_Masque.lua  .lua    Modified    5    25
** Removed some legacy code relating to the way that TMW icons are skinned with masque. Couldn't cause the config in ElvUI to change.

Components/IconTypes/IconType_meta/meta.lua  .lua    Modified    22    40
** Made some changes to the way that meta icons process the GUIDs that the icon is checking internally. Changes don't extend outside meta icon code.

TellMeWhen.lua  .lua    Modified    1    1
** Increased the version number. Can't break anything.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Many thanks for looking up those revisions. I have changed to every single revision, but suddenly everything went smooth. I therefore changed to the latest version and boom everything was bad again. Even with the revisions that first looked okay it was broken again. I have tried to fix it for 1,5 hours now and a bit tired. will have to choose between TMW and ElvUI I guess =[


> Posted by CurseForge user Jeremybell
